organisation.name: Greenwood College
organisation.about: Greenwood College is committed to delivering high-quality further education that supports learners in achieving their academic and vocational goals. We are seeking an enthusiastic and knowledgeable College Lecturer to deliver engaging lessons, support student progression, and contribute to the wider college community.
organisation.safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners and expect all staff to share this commitment.

title: Lecturer in construction
skillsAndExperience: The successful candidate will have strong subject knowledge in construction or a related discipline, with experience teaching or training learners in a further education or vocational setting. You will be confident delivering practical and classroom-based sessions, assessing learner work, and supporting students to develop both technical skills and industry readiness. Experience with curriculum planning, assessment, and working with awarding bodies is highly desirable.
whatSchoolOffers:
- A supportive and collaborative college environment
- Modern construction workshops and teaching facilities
- Opportunities for professional development and teaching qualifications
- Strong links with local employers and industry partners
- The chance to support learners progressing into apprenticeships, employment, or further study.
safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners, and expect all staff to share this commitment.
furtherDetailsAboutTheRole: Applicants should hold a relevant degree, HNC/HND, or industry-recognised qualification in construction or a related trade. A recognised teaching qualification, or willingness to work towards one, is desirable. Recent industry experience and knowledge of health and safety requirements would be an advantage. An enhanced DBS check will be required.

organisation.name: Hope College
organisation.about: Greenwood College is committed to delivering high-quality further education that supports learners in achieving their academic and vocational goals. We are seeking an enthusiastic and knowledgeable College Lecturer to deliver engaging lessons, support student progression, and contribute to the wider college community.
organisation.safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners and expect all staff to share this commitment.

title: Lecturer in applied sciences
skillsAndExperience: The successful candidate will have strong subject knowledge in science or a related discipline, with experience teaching or training learners in a further education or post-16 setting. You will be confident delivering engaging theoretical and practical lessons, supporting learners to develop scientific understanding and practical laboratory skills. Experience with curriculum planning, assessment, and promoting safe laboratory practice is highly desirable.
whatSchoolOffers:
- A supportive and collaborative college environment
- Access to well-equipped laboratories and teaching resources
- Opportunities for professional development and teaching qualifications
- A committed science teaching team focused on learner achievement
- The opportunity to inspire learners pursuing further study or careers in science-related fields.
safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners, and expect all staff to share this commitment.
furtherDetailsAboutTheRole: Applicants should hold a relevant degree in science or a related subject such as biology, chemistry, or physics. A recognised teaching qualification, or willingness to work towards one, is desirable. Experience delivering practical laboratory sessions and assessing learners in a post-16 or further education setting would be an advantage. An enhanced DBS check will be required.

organisation.name: Southgate College
organisation.about: Southgate College delivers a broad range of academic and vocational programmes. We are seeking a Functional Skills Maths Lecturer to teach and support learners working towards Level 1 and Level 2 qualifications.
organisation.safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners.

title: Functional Skills Maths Lecturer
skillsAndExperience: You will have experience delivering Functional Skills Maths and supporting learners with diverse educational needs.

organisation.name: Calderdale Institute of Technology
organisation.about: Calderdale Institute of Technology specialises in technical and engineering education. We are recruiting an Engineering Workshop Instructor to deliver practical training and support learners in a workshop environment.
organisation.safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners.

title: Engineering Workshop Instructor
skillsAndExperience: You will have industry experience in engineering and experience supporting or delivering practical training to learners.

organisation.name: Fenland College
organisation.about: Fenland College serves a diverse local community with a strong focus on adult education. We are looking for an ESOL Lecturer to deliver English language courses to adult learners.
organisation.safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners.

title: English Lecturer
skillsAndExperience: You will have experience teaching ESOL to adult learners and supporting learners from a range of cultural backgrounds.

organisation.name: Greenwood College
organisation.about: Greenwood College is committed to delivering high-quality further education that supports learners in achieving their academic and vocational goals. We are seeking a dedicated Psychology lecturer to help learners overcome barriers to learning and succeed in their studies.
organisation.safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners and expect all staff to share this commitment.

title: Psychology lecturer
skillsAndExperience: Ideal candidates will have experience supporting students in an education or training environment. Strong communication skills, empathy, and the ability to work collaboratively with teaching staff are essential.
whatSchoolOffers:
- A supportive and inclusive college environment
- Opportunities for professional development
- The chance to make a meaningful difference to learners’ educational journeys.
safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners, and expect all staff to share this commitment.
furtherDetailsAboutTheRole: Applicants should have relevant experience working with young people or adults in an educational setting. A DBS check is required.

organisation.name: Riverside Technical College
organisation.about: Riverside Technical College provides vocational and technical education to learners across the region, working closely with local employers to develop practical skills for employment. We are seeking a committed Sports science lecturer to support students in achieving positive outcomes and progressing to their next steps.
organisation.safeguardingCommitment: Riverside Technical College is committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of children, young people and vulnerable adults.

title: Sports science lecturer
skillsAndExperience: The successful candidate will have strong subject knowledge in sports science or a related discipline, with experience teaching or training learners in an educational or vocational setting. You will be confident delivering engaging practical and theoretical sessions, assessing learner progress, and supporting students to achieve academic and personal development goals. Experience with curriculum planning, assessment methods, and inclusive teaching practices is desirable.
whatSchoolOffers:
- A supportive and forward-thinking college environment
- Access to well-equipped sports and laboratory facilities
- Opportunities for professional development and teaching qualifications
- A collaborative teaching team committed to learner success
- The opportunity to inspire learners pursuing careers in sport, fitness, and health sciences.
safeguardingCommitment: We are committed to safeguarding and promoting the welfare of all learners and expect all staff to share this commitment.
furtherDetailsAboutTheRole: Applicants should hold a relevant degree in sports science, sport and exercise science, or a related subject. A recognised teaching qualification, or willingness to work towards one, is desirable. Experience delivering practical sessions and assessing learners in a post-16 or further education setting would be an advantage. An enhanced DBS check will be required.
